intro: Pouteria auahiensis, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a tropical plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant produces a fleshy, orange-colored fruit that contains several seeds. It thrives in humid, warm climates and is often found in coastal and lowland areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
